intro: Pyrrocoma demissa, commonly known as the narrow-leaf pyrrocoma, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive bracts and often medicinal properties. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered flowers that bloom in late spring. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in a fine layer of white hairs, giving them a silvery appearance. Pyrrocoma demissa is often found in rocky or gravelly soils in arid or semi-arid regions.
